title: Appointment of Dutchman Wopke Hoekstra as European commissioner faces criticism
description: The current Dutch foreign minister, who could be given the climate action portfolio, has faced backlash for his apparent insensitivity towards environmental issues.

title: World chess champion Magnus Carlsen and Hans Niemann end their quarrel
description: Carlsen had accused Niemann of cheating at an event last year but the two have resolved their issues and are ready to faceoff again in the future.

title: 5 dead, including 4 children, in 2 migrant boat sinkings off Greek islands near Turkish coast
description: 18 people were rescued after a boat carrying migrants apparently sank northeast of the Greek island of Lesbos, near the Turkish coast.

title: Lahaina blaze revives wounds of Hawaii's colonial past
description: At least 115 people died in the fires that ravaged the archipelago, including the island of Maui, on August 8.

title: French cinema proves it's alive and well at Angoulême festival
description: At the Francophone Film Festival held from August 22 to 27, the favorable results achieved by French productions were considered a good omen by film professionals.

title: Federal judge sets March 2024 for Trump's election subversion trial
description: The decision from US District Judge Tanya Chutkan denied a defense request to push the trial back until April 2026, about a year and a half after the 2024 election.

title: Spanish football's 'Rubiales affair' highlights the liberation of sportswomen's voices
description: Prosecutors at Spain's top criminal court opened a preliminary investigation over Spanish football chief Rubiales' forcible kiss. In the space of a week, the case has taken on unprecedented proportions.

title: EU must prepare to accept new members by 2030, Charles Michel says
description: The president of the European Council said on Monday it was crucial 'to set this clear goal' to accept new members from Eastern Europe.

title: UK flights delayed and canceled as a 'technical issue' hits air traffic control
description: Flight control operator National Air Traffic Services said its automated systems had experienced an unexplained 'technical issue' on Monday.

title: After Rammstein lead singer accused of sexual assault, German band enjoy triumphant tour
description: The famous German metal band played to full houses across Europe as an investigation was being carried out against Till Lindemann for alleged 'sexual offences.'

title: Spain opens preliminary sex abuse probe over kiss by Spanish football chief Rubiales
description: The top criminal court said it was launching an investigation after the Spanish soccer federation president appeared to forcibly kiss World Cup player Jenni Hermoso.

title: How America's vulnerable national parks are coping with climate change
description: From Yellowstone to Mojave and Everglades, America's natural sanctuaries are located in areas particularly hard hit by environmental changes, and must adapt accordingly.

title: Russian-Swede charged in Sweden with spying for Moscow
description: The dual national arrested last year in a spectacular helicopter raid on his Stockholm home was charged on Monday.

title: Macron says French ambassador still in Niger despite ultimatum
description: Niger's military rulers, who seized control of the government in July, had given the French envoy to the country 48 hours to leave on Friday.

title: Outcry in French town after woman prosecuted for walking topless
description: The woman, identified as Marina, has been accused of sexual exhibitionism by police. She said she was walking topless in Aurillac, central France, because it was hot and men have the right to do the same.

title: Paris 2024: One year before the Paralympic Games begins, accessibility remains the big challenge
description: The organizers have given an initial assessment of the progress made in terms of logistics, as Monday marks 'D - 1 year' to the start of the competition.

title: Prigozhin supporters in Moscow pay tribute to 'true patriot'
description: Supporters stood solemnly before an improvised memorial: a line of red roses and pictures of the mercenary chief.

title: Simone Biles wins record 8th US Gymnastics title
description: Ten years after winning her first title, the 26-year-old also became the oldest woman to win the national all-around title.

title: From De La Soul to Schubert: Le Monde's end of summer concert picks
description: Le Monde helps you escape the back-to-school blues with its selection of unmissable musical events.

title: French secularism: Education minister to ban abayas in public schools
description: Reports of breaches of secularism have increased over the past year in France. The new Minister of Education intends to clarify a situation that his predecessor had left partly up to the discretion of school heads.

title: Zimbabwe's opposition challenges election results
description: The opposition Citizens Coalition for Change (CCC) refused to ratify President Emmerson Mnangagwa proclaimed re-election victory while asserting that they won the election.

title: Romania's demographic decline is crippling its economy
description: Five million Romanians have emigrated elsewhere in Europe while companies investing in the country are struggling to recruit workers.

title: Who after Macron? The dance of the ambitious has begun
description: In 2027, the French president will hit his term limit. His own allies, including Gérald Darmanin, Edouard Philippe, Bruno Le Maire, and Gabriel Attal, are vying to appear as potential successors, at the risk of fracturing a fragile governing coalition, writes Le Monde's Solenn de Royer.

title: Chinese youth are rethinking their relationship to work
description: In China, young professionals are celebrating resignation with great fanfare as a symbol of rejecting tradition and seeking personal fulfillment.

title: Libya suspends foreign minister over talks with Israeli counterpart
description: Najla Al-Mangoush and Eli Cohen met in Italy where they discussed, according to the Israeli foreign minister, the prospect of reinstating diplomatic ties between their respective nations.

title: Japan's high school baseball hair revolution
description: Japan's high school baseball system is embracing change by letting go of the traditional buzz cut requirement, marking a shift towards autonomy and empowerment for players.
